title.narrative: Provision of Integrated Life-Saving Emergency Health, Nutrition and Basic WASH Services for AWD/Cholera, measles and drought Affected and Vulnerable Communities In Bay Region

description.narrative: Project Summary : The project will be an integrated emergency lifesaving humanitarian project that comprises of multi cluster services including WASH, health and Nutrition services which are provided as one package in each site and will benefit the most vulnerable and AWD/Cholera, measles and drought affected communities mainly focusing on new IDPs and vulnerable community members in hard to reach areas and among IDPs displaying high GAM rates in Burhakaba and Baidao districts. The project will be complementary to ongoing SAMA protection and food security project in the two districts. The proposed intervention will be delivered through integrated response teams to provide services to 17,500 vulnerable men, women and children including those in hard to reach IDPs and villages. Health: - Provision of lifesaving outpatient consultations to 17500 drought/AWD affected communities through 2 outreach services (1 per district) with equal access to women, girls, boys and men in Baidao and Burhakaba Districts. - Routine and supplementary immunization services to approximately 3500 children under the age of five years - Improvement the quality service delivery through capacity building of IERT health staff , CHWs as well as organizing workshops to 75 community members at target beneficiaries. Nutrition: - Provision of lifesaving nutrition interventions will be provided by scaling up community-based IMAM program (Community mobilization, OTP/SFP and SC) through two mobile clinics in line with EPHS Somali framework - At least acute malnourished children (825 boys and 825 girls) will have access and utilization of integrated essential quality nutrition services of OTP/TSFP for under five children and 900 pregnant and lactating women - Scaling up prevention strategy that addresses both underlying and immediate causes of malnutrition. For example, scale up IYCF interventions (promotion of exclusive breastfeeding and complementing feeding), mass vaccination, disease prevention and response. - Organize IYCF Counselling both individual and group counselling for caregivers bringing their children to IERT - To enhance optimum nutrition and hygiene practices at target locations, SAMA will: Conduct monthly sessions on nutrition and hygiene targeting caretakers of children 6-59 months and the general population Enhance the capacity of 23 nutrition staff (13 female, 10 male) on Integrated Management of Acute Malnutrition (IMAM,) and Infant and Young Child Feeding (IYCF) treatment guidelines WASH: In order to prevent the spread of AWD/cholera diseases and malnutrition against children and women, SAMO will: - Rehabilitate of boreholes and 4 shallow wells with hand pumps benefiting a total of 7500 (1125 men, 1875 women, 2250 girls and 2250 boys). - Capacity building of 5 WASH committees and 10 well operators on water source management. The WASH committees and the well operators will be equally shared by men and women - Construction 30 gender segregated IDP toilets with lockable doors and hand washing facilities. - Conduct training to the 25 Community health workers on best practices to disseminate hygiene education to 17,500 target men, women and children beneficiaries to promote and enable the adaption of good hygiene and sanitation practices through visiting house-to-house, schools, health and nutrition facilities including those who are visiting our outreach clinics. - Provide WASH HP kits to 300 families with malnourished children.
